channel.title: Zigbee on SCL Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Zigbee on SCL Blog

item.title: Smart Things 433mhz
item.author: team@silocitylabs.com (Silo City Labs)
item.description: Going to be creating a receiver to translate 433mhz sensors to smart things, Most likely going to be using a esp8266 to make it easier to configure. I still have to figure out how to identify the smart things hub withouth manually entering in its ip, maybe upnp? I also bought a CC2530 chip for zigbee testing, Not sure what im going to do with that yet. Edit: I think I may have made a mistake buying zigbee chips.
